body_html:
I came across this issue and the solution worked for me but in my case I was saving the image back.
So without casting like this the image has only noise. After casting it is the same image.

Save after resizing :

def resize(image):
resized_image = tf.cast(tf.image.resize_images(image, [299, 299]), tf.uint8)
return resized_image

document_tensor = Image.fromarray(document_tensor, "RGB")
body_text:
I came across this issue and the solution worked for me but in my case I was saving the image back.
So without casting like this the image has only noise. After casting it is the same image.
Save after resizing :
def resize(image):
resized_image = tf.cast(tf.image.resize_images(image, [299, 299]), tf.uint8)
return resized_image
document_tensor = Image.fromarray(document_tensor, "RGB")
body:
I came across this issue and the solution worked for me but in my case I was saving the image back.
So without casting like this the image has only noise. After casting it is the same image.

Save after resizing :
 
   def resize(image):
    resized_image = tf.cast(tf.image.resize_images(image, [299, 299]), tf.uint8)
    return resized_image

   document_tensor = Image.fromarray(document_tensor, "RGB")
